name: Aditya Banerjee
headline: Part developer, part musician.
JavaScript is my poison of choice.

tooltips.allProjects: Click on a project's title to view its GitHub page.

projects.fallbackDescription: This project does not have a description.

featured.name: Beings of Habit
longDescription: Being of Habit is a holistic health and wellness platform that aims to explore 3 central pillars of life: fitness, nutrition and well-being. It was conceptualised by girlfriend Ishita, aiming to explore the latest in the health and wellness space, drawing inspiration from evidence-based podcasts, books, publications, social media and more.

The platform was originally created using SquareSpace, which lacks the flexibility that Ishita wanted. As a result, we started rebuilding the platform using NextJS and TailwindCSS. Additionally, we created a simple CMS (Content Management System) to allow the website's blog section to be managed easily.

I also took this project as a learning opportunity; I explored potential technology stacks and analysed them to choose what I felt would be the best fit for the project. I also gained hands-on experience with the AWS and Terraform, which I used to deploy our custom CMS.
This project is currently in progress, but the GitHub repository can be found here.

featured.name: EchoFinder
longDescription: EchoFinder is RAG-based chat history search engine that allows users to search for messages in a conversation, created in collaboration with my long-time friend and frequent collaborator Vishesh. It uses an embedding model to convert messages into vectors, which are then stored in a vector database. EchoFinder then uses these vectors to perform a similarity search, allowing users to find messages that match their search prompt. EchoFinder is primarily a Telegram Bot, but can also be self-hosted to use with WhatsApp.

The Telegram and WhatsApp bots are built using NodeJS along with Node-Telegram-Bot-API, and WhatsApp-Web.js, respectively. The embeddings are automatically generated by ChromaDB using all-MiniLM-L6-v2 before being stored in the vector database.
Here is a link to the project's GitHub repository.

featured.name: TeleDr
longDescription: TeleDR is an LLM-based chat summarisation bot that allows users to summarise the last n messages in a conversation. I created TeleDr alongside my friend Vishesh, with whom I collaborate quite frequently for various side-projects. Although TeleDR is intended for use with Telegram, it can also be self-hosted for use with WhatsApp.
The Telegram bot is built with NodeJS and Node-Telegram-Bot-API. The WhatsApp bot is built with NodeJS and WhatsApp-Web.js. The summarisation is performed using LangChain and LLaMa3.
Here is a link to the project's GitHub repository.

timeline.name: üìö OFS
timeline.description: Took computer science at the higher level under the international baccalaureate program at the Overseas Family School, Singapore.
longDescription: I started the International Baccalaureate Programme at the Overseas Family School in Singapore in August 2015.
My subjects included Computer Science, Economics and Theatre at the higher level, and French, Mathematics and English Language at the standard level.
Outside of academics, I was also heavily involved in the school's cultural and sporting activities, including theatre productions, music concerts, cricket matches.
Having gained a strong theoretical knowledge of computer science and hands-on experience with Java programming, I decided to pursue undergraduate studies in Computer Science.

timeline.name: üá∏üá¨ SAF
timeline.description: Served national service in the Singapore Armed Forces as a 3rd sergeant at the 42nd Singapore Armoured Regiment.
longDescription: I enlisted in the Singapore Armed Forces in July 2017. I started my service as a recruit in 1st Company, Basic Military Training Centre School 4 in Pulau Tekong.

On the merit of my performance in BMT (Basic Military Training). I was selected to attend the Specialist Cadet School (SCS) at Pasir Laba Camp to train to become a 3rd Sergeant. The first portion of SCS training was completed in Pasir Laba camp, and the second portion was conducted at the Armour Training Institute (ATI) at Sungei Gedong camp. At ATI, I was trained to be a 3rd sergeant in the Singapore Armed Forces' Armour vocation.

Upon completion of my training at ATI, I was sent to train in Germany for a month under exercise Panzer Strike. Upon my return, I was posted to the 42nd Singapore Armoured Regiment, where I served as a 3rd sergeant.
During my time in the SAF, I was known for maintaining an extremely high level of fitness, consistently scoring above 90 in fitness tests graded out of 100.

timeline.name: üéì NUS
timeline.description: Enrolled in the Bachelor of Computing Program at the National University of Singapore, majoring in Computer Science.
longDescription: In August 2019, I enrolled in the Bachelor of Computing Program at the National University of Singapore, majoring in Computer Science.
I was also able to secure a stay at Residential College 4 (RC4) for the first 2 years of my study, a coveted residence for students that pass the interview process.

During my time at NUS, I was able to take part in various extracurricular activities. I was a member of Amplified, a student-led collection of rock bands where I performed as a vocalist and drummer. I also co-captained RC4's Dodgeball team for semester, finishing as a runner-up at inter-college games. I was also the publicity head for RC4's Musical Expression Club, and a member of the RC4 Road Relay team.
Due to my warm and outgoing personality, I was selected as an orientation group leader (OGL) for 2 successive years, helping 2 new batches of students find their feet in NUS and at RC4.

timeline.name: üßÆ Strive Math
timeline.description: Started my first software engineering internship with Strive Math (YC21).
longDescription: In May 2020, I started an internship with Strive Math (YC21), a then pre-seed startup provided tailored online mathematics and coding lessons.

I worked at Strive as a software engineering intern, as well as a tutor. My key contributions included the automation of payroll, quality control and analytics systems. I also consistently received positive feedback from students and parents for my patient and effective tutoring.

timeline.name: üë®üèΩ‚Äçüè´ OURFinals
timeline.description: Established an ad-hoc on-demand peer tutoring platform for university students. Conducted a Python coding bootcamp with the team.
longDescription: OURFinals was an ad-hoc on-demand peer tutoring service for university students. It aimed to bring students and peer tutors together on a per-gig basis.

I launched the company with my batch-mates Robin, Arnav and Niki. This was my first exposure towards conceptualising and launching a business. Although the startup did not take off, I learned valuable lessons to apply to my next venture.

timeline.name: üè´ NOC
timeline.description: Enrolled in the NUS Overseas Colleges (NOC) Programme.
longDescription: In August 2021, I was accepted into the NUS Overseas Colleges (NOC) Programme after passing a rigorous interview process.
The programme is designed to provide students with a unique opportunity to study abroad and gain international experience in a variety of fields, such as business and engineering.

Additionally, the programme includes entrepreneurship classes at a partner university, where students can learn about the startup culture and gain practical experience in conceptualising and launching a business.
Through the NOC Programme, I was able to gain valuable experience in a foreign country, which allowed me to broaden my perspective and develop my language skills.

timeline.name: üíª ByondXR
timeline.description: Started an internship with ByondXR as frontend developer.
longDescription: As part of the NUS Overseas Colleges (NOC) Programme, I started an internship with ByondXR in January 2022.
ByondXR is an extended-reality e-commerce company that used their virtual store builder to create immersive shopping experiences for a range of high-profile luxury fashion brands.

Initially, I worked on Byond's legacy platform, creating RxJS plugins to add interactivity to virtual stores. However, on the account of my excellent performance, I was transferred to the team responsible for the company's new store builder platform, which was built using ReactJS, GraphQL and MongoDB.
I continued to work part-time with ByondXR until February 2023.

timeline.name: ‚ö°Ô∏è FNSHR
timeline.description: Established FNSHR, a task management platform that leveraged social and monetary accountability to incentivise task completion.
longDescription: FNSHR (pronounced "finisher") was a task management platform that leveraged social and monetary accountability to encourage task completion.

I conceptualised it along with my fellow NOC alumni Robin and Asaad, and together, we pitched it at the N-House (residence for NOC alumni) Pitch Night at NUS. We finished in second place, allowing us to participate in a final-round pitch to NUS Enterprise, NUS's VC arm. Unfortunately, we were unable to secure seed funding and halted operations for the foreseeable future. However, I still do believe in the idea and hope to pursue it again in the future.

timeline.name: üë®üèΩ‚Äçüéì Graduation
timeline.description: Graduated from NUS with a Bachelor of Computing (Honours) degree in Computer Science.
longDescription: In July 2023, I graduated from NUS with a Bachelor of Computing (Honours) degree in Computer Science.

timeline.name: üëî Activate Interactive
timeline.description: Began my first full-time job as a full-stack developer at Activate Interactive.
longDescription: Upon graduating from NUS, I commenced my first job as a Senior Programmer Analyst at Activate Interactive.

Throughout my time at Activate, I was assigned as a full-stack developer for the CRISP project: A secure and compliant automated cloud environment and resource provisioning platform, developed in collaboration with Amazon Web Services Singapore and the Singapore Ministry of Manpower.

I developed significant portions of 4 out of the 7 backend microservices for the project, as well as the corresponding frontend modules. I also authored a large number of automation scripts to improve developer experience.
Through this experience, I was able to gain expertise with NodeJS, Express, React, PostgreSQL and various AWS services.

timeline.name: ü§ñ AI Practitioner
timeline.description: Completed the AWS Certified AI Practitioner exam.
longDescription: After gaining some foundational exposure to AI through some of my side-projects, I decided to certify what I had learned so far.
I took on the AWS AI Practitioner certification, passing with a strong score. Since the certification was quite new, I was also granted an early adopter badge.

timeline.name: üá¨üáß London
timeline.description: Moved to London to pursue my career goals.
longDescription: After graduating from NUS, I became eligible for the UK's High Potential Individual (HPI) visa.
Having been granted the visa, I decided to explore opportunities in London, relocating in February 2025.

timeline.name: ‚è≥ Coming Soon... Solutions Architect
timeline.description: Will take on the AWS Associate Solutions Architect exam.
longDescription: I plan to take on the AWS Associate Solutions Architect exam in March 2025, and hopefully pass it!

posts.name: So I rebuilt my portfolio site...
posts.description: A deep-dive into how and why I rebuilt my portfolio site.

prompts.question: üèÜ What's your professional background?
responses: I am a full-stack developer with 3 years of experience in the JavaScript ecosystem. I am especially well-versed with the PERN (Postgres, Express, React and Node) stack.

I am a full-stack JavaScript developer with 3 years of experience through my tenures at Strive Math, ByondXR and Activate Interactive. My key strengths include Node.js, Express, React, and Postgres, although I have experience with a wide range of other technologies as well.

I have 3 years of experience in the JavaScript ecosystem, with a focus on full-stack development. My experience includes working with Strive Math, ByondXR, and Activate Interactive. Through my experience, I have developed a strong understanding of Node.js, Express, React, and Postgres, among many other technologies.

prompts.question: üéì Where did you study?
responses: I studied higher level computer science under the International Baccalaureate Programme at Overseas Family School, Singapore. Subsequently, I completed a Bachelor of Computing (Honours) degree at the National University of Singapore, majoring in Computer Science.

I completed my International Baccalaureate Diploma at Overseas Family School in Singapore, where I took higher-level computer science. Later, I pursued a Bachelor of Computing (Honours) degree at the National University of Singapore, specializing in Computer Science.

My academic journey started with an International Baccalaureate Diploma at Overseas Family School in Singapore, where I focused on computer science. I then went on to complete a Bachelor of Computing (Honours) degree in Computer Science at the National University of Singapore.

prompts.question: üíº What are you currently working on?
responses: I'm currently improving my understanding of cloud technologies by preparing for and taking on AWS cloud certifications. I'm also strengthening my understanding of Web3 technologies, Solidity and Rust by working on projects that leverage these technologies.

I'm currently working on improving my expertise in cloud and Web3 technologies, Rust and Solidity. I'm doing this by taking on AWS cloud courses and certifications, and working on projects that leverage these technologies.

Currently, I'm working on improving my understanding of cloud technologies by preparing for and taking on AWS cloud certifications. I am also strengthening my understanding of Web3 technologies, Solidity and Rust by using these technologies in hands-on projects.

prompts.question: üõ†Ô∏è What's your favorite tech stack right now?
responses: I don't think this is an actual recognised stack name, but I'm really enjoying the BSD (Bun, SvelteKit and Drizzle) stack. The maintainers have put in a lot of effort to enable a seamless developer experience, and I've definitely noticed that.
I'm currently a big fan of the BSD (Bun, SvelteKit, and Drizzle) stack. It provides an incredibly smooth developer experience, with minimal setup and great performance, making it a joy to work with.
Lately, I've been loving the BSD stack (Bun, SvelteKit, and Drizzle). The combination makes development feel effortless, and I appreciate how lightweight and intuitive it is compared to other stacks.

prompts.question: üî• What technologies do you specialise in?
responses: I would say I'm particularly experienced with technologies in the JavaScript ecosystem. I'm particularly strong at React, Node.js and Express. I also work well with a wide range of SQL and NoSQL databases! My Python skills aren't too bad either.

My expertise primarily lies in JavaScript and its ecosystem. I'm highly proficient in React, Node.js, and Express. Additionally, I have experience working with both SQL and NoSQL databases and am comfortable with Python as well.

I'm well-versed in full-stack JavaScript development, especially with React, Node.js, and Express. I'm also experienced with SQL and NoSQL databases, and while JavaScript is my primary focus, I have a solid grasp of Python too.

prompts.question: üöÄ Can you tell me about a cool project you've worked on?
responses: In 2024, I created a Telegram Bot called EchoFinder with my friend Vishesh. The bot allowed users to locate old messages that matched their search prompt. It was super interesting because it was my first time working with embeddings models and a vector database!

In 2023, I established a task management platform called FNSHR. The platform was built using NextJS and MongoDB, and was integrated with Stripe to handle payments. It was pretty stressful because I was building it for a pitch competition, but I was super proud that I was able to put it together in just a couple of days.

In 2024, I started working on holistic fitness and wellness platform called Beings of Habit with my girlfriend Ishita. The project is still a work in progress, and we're aiming to release it this year. I've enjoyed working on it a lot because it has served as a great opportunity to refresh my knowledge of NextJS, and gain hands-on experience using cloud and IaC technologies such as AWS and Terraform.

prompts.question: üéØ What's your portfolio site built with?
responses: My old portfolio site was built with Astro, React and TailwindCSS. My new portfolio site (this one) was built with SvelteKit, DrizzleORM and Tailwind CSS. I've enjoyed working with SvelteKit a lot because there's a lot less boilerplate as opposed to React or NextJS, and I feel that runes and writables are much easier to work with than hooks and contexts. Additionally, the SvelteKit team has crafted a beautiful and intuitive developer experience, and I'm really excited to see what they build in the future!

My previous portfolio was built using Astro, React, and TailwindCSS. However, for this iteration, I switched to SvelteKit, DrizzleORM, and Tailwind CSS. I love the simplicity of SvelteKit, especially how Svelte reduces boilerplate compared to React, and the ecosystem feels polished and intuitive.

I initially built my portfolio with Astro and React but later migrated to SvelteKit, DrizzleORM, and TailwindCSS. The developer experience with SvelteKit is fantastic, and I really appreciate how straightforward and minimalistic Svelte feels compared to React.

prompts.question: üéÆ What do you do outside of coding?
responses: Outside of coding, I like to watch movies and TV shows, spend time with my family, girlfriend and friends, sing and play guitar, cook, eat and exercise!

When I'm not coding, I enjoy watching movies, spending time with my family and friends, singing and playing guitar, cooking, and working out. I also love discovering new restaurants and trying different cuisines.

Beyond coding, I like to unwind by watching TV shows and movies, singing and playing guitar, hanging out with my loved ones, experimenting with new recipes in the kitchen, and staying active through exercise.

prompts.question: üìñ Where do you get your favourite tech content?
responses: I've been an avid follower of Fireship, the Primagen, Theo (from t3.gg), and Web Dev Simplified for a few years now, and I watch their content regularly. I also recently subscribed to daily.dev, which is a great website that aggregates a lot of the content that I'm interested in. Lastly, I follow a lot of tech-related subreddits.

I regularly watch content from Fireship, the Primagen, Theo (t3.gg), and Web Dev Simplified. I also use daily.dev to keep up with the latest articles and follow various tech subreddits for discussions and insights.
My go-to sources for tech content are Fireship, the Primagen, Theo (t3.gg), and Web Dev Simplified. I also stay updated through daily.dev and engage with discussions on tech-focused subreddits.

prompts.question: üåç Why did you move to London?
responses: I moved to London because I've lived in Singapore for most of my life, and wanted to gain some exposure overseas. Graduating from NUS made me eligible for the UK's High Potential Individual (HPI) visa, which made relocating to the UK a viable option.

I wanted to experience living and working in a new environment after spending most of my life in Singapore. Thanks to my NUS degree, I qualified for the UK's High Potential Individual (HPI) visa, making London an exciting and feasible choice.

Having spent most of my life in Singapore, I wanted to explore new opportunities abroad. The UK's HPI visa, which I became eligible for through my NUS degree, provided a great pathway to move to London.
